title: We all love it!
body: I purchased this for my son's 4th birthday. This was 2 months ago. Everyone played with it-even our tree guy a few weeks ago. I would suggest buying extra rockets if you have a wooded play area. Alot of our rockets ended up in the trees...eventually they come down, but extras are nice.This toy makes me smile when I play with it.

title: Christmas present
body: We gave this item to our grandson. He plays with it all day long.This item is great toy for kids and very durable too.

title: Five Stars
body: Was a gift

title: children love it.
body: A home run, children love it.

title: Five Stars
body: Best gift

title: Awesome
body: This toy is great fun for all ages. My two year old, six year old and the neighborhood kids love to see how high they can make the rocket soar.  Mom enjoys it too@!

title: loved this
body: kids had great fun with this, however, pieces got lost and  because my grandchildren live in Brazil...no easy replacement of item it was not a great toy. So it went to toy heaven rather quickly.  If I had lived in the US I could have easily bought replacement or even a whole new toy.....I have bought it for my sister who has two grandsons in the US and the boys are enjoying it.

title: Five Stars
body: fun

title: fantastic toy
body: children of all ages seem to like it and adults as well. Fantastic for an outdoor family or friends get together.

title: Grandson's Favorite Christmas Toy
body: After having some of the toys I've given my grandsons (ages 4 and 6) pushed aside in favor of others, I was delighted with the joy and attention the Ultra Stomp Rocket received.  For nearly the entire two days of their visit, one or both of them played with the Stomp Rocket. I'm sure it was probably meant to be an outdoor toy, but weather keep us inside.  We had rockets flying, but nothing was broken, and now I cherish the memories of those boys' delight.  AND it does NOT require batteries!

title: loved it
body: best toy for the price!!! Have had more fun w/ such a simple idea. I Recommend this for everyone of every age!

title: Grand-daughters' Christmas present.
body: She loved it . It will assist in draining a lot of that young ladys' excess energy when Spring rolls around.

title: Five Stars
body: Nephew LOVES it!

title: awesome
body: I bought two of these for my grandsons 5 and 3, they said it was an awesome present!!!  They took them outside and had a great time, little 1 year old brother was fascinated by them too!  Dad even got in the act shooting the rockets in the air.

title: Definately not worth the money
body: Paid over 40.00 for two of these and they fell apart the day we got them.  (Christmas day!) Would like to get our money back.

title: Fun x 5
body: Purchased this for my 5 grandsons, ages 4, 8, 11 & 13, and it was an instant hit with all of them!  From hand-held rocket wars starting at the Christmas tree, to distance competitions in the yard they are having a great time.    I bought the extra rockets to lessen the pick-up time between playing, and that was a good idea.  Also, read reviews before purchasing and added a zip-tie to stablize the base.    The youngest boys (twins) have just turned 4 and were actually the first to get theirs unboxed and flying, scoring several hits on their older brothers, and their Dad, before they had to retreat from return fire.    We're loving it!!

title: Stomp Rocket
body: This is very fun game for the kids. There are more complicated ones, i.e. a stomp rocket with two rockets however, this is by far a sturdier one and the rocket does not get stuck as in the other ones. It is also light for kids as young as 2 years. The other ones will not move with such a light weight of a 2-year old.

title: Stomp Rocket
body: Gave these to the grandkids for Christmas and they loved them. I'm glad I made this purchase.  Everyone was happy. Great product.

title: I love these things!
body: In AU we pay twice the price for these so firstly Amazon, it's nice to pay what these are actually worth..We had one of these for our first child and let me say that they are so much fun. We took the last one everywhere; the park, the beach, to friend's houses, we even used it as a space game at our son's birthday party to see who could fire their rocket to the moon (or closest in any case..)Anyway I bought one at Christmas for our nephew and when it arrived I got my five year old daughter to wrap it. "What's this?" she asked me. I explained how it worked (Santa had one for her as well but she does not know this yet) and she said "I must tell Santa that I really want one of these too, please mum can we go see him now so I can ask for one?"So Santa will be bringing another one to our house at Christmas, and I can't wait. So much fun again... and so simple and inexpensive...

title: Active fun
body: The Stop Rocket Ultra goes up to 200 feet,  and the rocket tip is much is bigger in diameter (about 2 inches) & has a large foam bulbous end on the rocket, so if you were hit at close range in the face it probably wouldn't hurt...think of 8 year olds playing with these.  It comes with 4 rockets.  This one is for ages 8 and up but it looks like any age would have fun with it without getting hurt.  The Super High Performance Stomp Rocket goes up to 400 feet, the rocket tip is the same size as the rocket, about 1 inch in diameter, with a rounded plastic tip, so if it hit someone at close range it could hurt.  It is It comes with 6 rockets and is for ages 16 and up.  Younger responsible kids should be fine with it.

title: fun
body: i bought it to replace someone's i ran over. out of curiousity i tried it out. i shot a rocket up and got it stuck 60 feet up in a tree; i am still waiting for a storm to knock it down. this works for kids and adults

title: My grandson was thrilled........
body: Just a simple toy but very safe to use in the house and somehow very exciting to my grandson.  He still loves it and plays with it often.

title: Fun toy for 'Rocketeers'
body: Our 4 year old grandson loved the rocket and has mastered the "two foot jump stomp" to launch the rocket,

title: ... gave this as a Christmas present and the kids LOVED it.
body: I gave this as a Christmas present and the kids LOVED it.

title: Five Stars
body: our 3 year old grandson LOVES this thing.

title: I just wish it was better made.
body: This toy is very poorly made. I can not get the legs to stay together. also when you tighten the tube at the end it doesnt stay where you want it too, you cant tighten it enough. That said my 5.5 year old daughter still enjoys it. I just wish it was better made.

title: Adding to the positive reviews
body: The rocket is a big hit for kids--and for their fathers who can't resist trying it.  This makes an excellent gift.

title: I scored on a great Christmas gift for a 3 Year old
body: I gave this to the little boy next door for Christmas And him and his twin sister loved it And that made me very happy

title: Encourages outdoor play
body: We first got one of these as a gift for my 3 year old, who loved it both indoors and out. We repurchased it for a space themed 5th birthday party and the kids had a wonderful time playing with it. Very durable and straightforward. The rockets do go very high but a very enjoyable toy to encourage outdoor play.

title: Great Fun!!
body: Wow! For a relatively inexpensive toy, this provided hours of fun for a 5 year old and (later ... I bought two) for a 7 year old. Shoots high, is easy to use and safe. Boys (of all ages) will love this!

title: Five Stars
body: My 9 year old grandson loved it--tons of fun!

title: nephew was excited
body: My nephew was excited to receive this as a gift, but I have not heard whether or not it works well.

title: Lots of Fun, No Skill Required
body: I bought the Stomp Rocket Jr. Glow Kit as a fun gift for my three year old son. The Amazon reviews were over the top positive and the price tag was low--so I thought why not? This item has far exceeded my expectations. This is my favorite toy ever, and my son is in complete agreement.The idea is that you stomp on the stomp box to send one of four foam rockets flying through the air. It is so easy, addictive, and fun. The stomp box is soft so even my three year old can send rockets hurtling 50 feet or more into the air. The air rushes through a flexible tube that you put the foam rocket on and sends it way higher than you think you're going to send it. The whole set up is connected to a plastic stand of three pieces that you snap together. Only a single wing nut attachment (included)is needed to hold it all together.You can angle the tube to send the rocket straight up, horizontally, or on a variety of trajectories. The foam rockets are very durable. They are soft so I wouldn't let a dog or cat chew them, but they have been indestructible in my son's overeager hands and have lasted damage-free through thousands of launches.My son is still working on coordination and has tripped over the stand on multiple occasions so it does come apart rather easily, but it just snaps back together--no big deal. I'd like to see an improvement in future versions, but I don't see a reason to downgrade the rating for this small inconvenience.We played with it for around an hour and a half the first time that we used it. If you have a child this young, then you know the miracle of keeping a child entertained that long. It is an outdoor toy for sure, but I'm thinking we'll get use out of it in a hallway or children's playroom during stormy days. I hope you'll order one if you are on the fence about it. The whole family will love it.

title: Flimsy
body: Great fun but a little flimsy on the base. Have found when the kids get a bit excited then the base comes apart easily.

title: So Much FUN
body: I got this for my 2 year nephew and 5 year old niece and they love seeing how high they can send the rockets!  Perfect age appropriate gift for the 2 year old.

title: Kids of All Ages Enjoy this toy !
body: We are using the toy for the 2nd summer and still enjoying it. My grand sons were tough on the rockets but they still fly.  Everyone wants to try this, it's great fun and great exercise for the whole family. We have a huge yard and have great competitions.  Well worth the $$ and everyone asks 'where did you get that'?

title: Works great.  Doesn't stay 'unbroken' very long in my house- dogs.
body: Totally works but won't last very long if you have lots of little kids or dogs!  It is fragile to certain types of handeling.But other than that it works great and the kids love it.  It is also easy enough for little kids to do on their own yet fun enough for bigger kids to have a blast with.  (Just watch your dogs!)  They think it is their job to get the rockets after blast off.

title: My kids love it
body: Perfect toy for young children.  They love stomping (or more frequently jumping on it) and shooting the rocket.  The rocket doesn't break anything but does get some good velocity.Durability?  Well, the three-pronged stand that holds the end of the tube that fires the rocket is awkwardly designed and generally not used.  My kids typically hold the tube itself and point it at something while stomping.  They wish the tube was longer. The pieces come apart and get lost long before anything breaks.My younger one does like to chew on the rockets.  I can't fault the toy for that.Great fun.  They don't play with it very frequently, but when they do, they love it.

title: A friend of mine recommended this toy & it did not disappoint
body: A friend of mine recommended this toy & it did not disappoint.  My 3 yr old grandson had so much fun with this!  It was a hit with him & all the adults as well!

title: Buy superglue to fix it
body: I wish my 3 year old didn't like this so much or I'd return it now. Rocket 1 of 4 broke day 1 after 5 minutes. It looks like they sacrificed the weight of a big foam tip for a scheaper then cheap shaft and fins.  Base could have a little more weight to it.  I would suggest manufacturer include a tube of superglue so we can try to fix these fins that are not meant to survive at all.  I'll have to wait to return until the other rockets break tomorrow and my kid cries.  Really a terribly cheap product that has no chance of surviving any children.

title: After child opens and is set-up this is always the favorite toy of the party
body: My go to toy for kids 3 to 12 years old.  After child opens and is set-up this is always the favorite toy of the party.  All the kids want one!I have purchased numerous ones.  Keep one at home for visiting children.  I cannot express to you what a hit this item is with kids...its amazing!Multi-age groups, no batteries, inexpensive...buy it, buy two, you won't regret it!

title: A lot of fun!
body: This was a gift and the receiver was very happy with the gift.  It was especially appropriate for a 4 year old.

title: and they love it!
body: got 2 for my 2 five year old nephews, and they love it!

title: Fun toy
body: My  nine-year-old grandson was delighted with this toy.  He played with it for hours.  I only wish I had bought more of the rockets.

title: Fun for a short time
body: The Ultra Stomp rocket arrived within 4 days and in good condition.  The boys had to give it go even though it was snowing and cold outside.  They enjoyed it but it has been put away until warmer weather arrives  .. will have to wait till the weather breaks to get more details.

title: Fun! No bells or whistles
body: Fun! No bells or whistles. Kids love it and take turns! It flies high and even little ones can make it work, if they have enough weight behind the stomp. But they love trying, all the same, and usually get it to fly eventually!

title: Five Stars
body: grandkids played for hours with this.

title: CHEAP
body: I have no idea how this product got 4 plus stars out of 1,000 plus reviews. And I only give it 2 instead of 1 star bc of the fun factor. It is soooo poorly made, a piece broke (part of the flimsy base) when my husband was putting it together today.  You literally have to sit and hold the base and hose for it to work properly. My friends son had one that was WAY better so shop around, there's better out there. I was hoping this one would be the same but was extremely disappointed. It should cost $5, not $15. It was really a waste of $ but not sure I'll return it bc the kids are having fun with it. DO NOT BUY.

title: Birthday gifts
body: Have given this twice as birthday gifts and both times they were well received and played with immediately. I love that the kids are active and getting outside and you cant beat the entertainment for the price!

title: Lots of Fun
body: My 5 year old and 7 year old both love this.  We like that you can angle the rockets different ways as well.

title: A Favorite Toy on our Block!
body: This is the hit of every party we attend. Moms always come to me afterwards asking where we got this amazing toy. Definitely order a package of refills!

title: Very satisfying for young and old!
body: Our family consists of three generations, the youngest just 4, the oldest over 60. Everybody loves the Stomp Rockets. We got both an Ultra and a Jr, allowing for both indoor and outdoor sharing. True to a review I read here, when going to the park, the Stomp Rockets are a magnet for meeting new people. A reliable source of good clean high-energy fun!

title: Fun at the Campsite
body: This toy is just fun.  There is something inherently fabulous about stomping on a bag of air and launching a glowing rocket into the sky.  Our teenagers, kiddos, and parents all had a...well...blast.

title: Great
body: Easy to understand and play, my son loved it and the projectile flies high really.loved is tough, and very simple and fun.

title: rocket fins rip
body: The ultra stomp rocket is lots of fun,rated for ages 8+ but even my 5 yr. old nephew (could get it 15-20 ft. up) loved it. You can easily set the rocket to launch at any angle you like,the older kids (10+)  like to aim it at each other and try to catch it , unless you were hit in the eye I don't see how you could get hurt. You will never get near the claimed 200ft. , a ten yr. old might get 80ft. (achieved only by JUMPING on the 8'X4.5' air filled launch pad) which is great and thrills most, a teen could get 100ft. and it's at that point where the problems start. The plastic tail fins can't withstand the force that the sudden acceleration required to achieve that hight puts upon them and they are ripped apart. If you're lucky you might get 3-4 blasts of 100 to a max of maybe 110ft. and once the fins are ruined they only go 30ft maximum. My only other issue which is minor is the 3 pieces that connect to form the T shaped frame that lays on the ground and supports the launch tube,this pops apart occasionally on hard launches. I solved this issue by using an  elastic band around the joint where the 3 pieces meet. All said, great fun for all ages but don't let the big kids JUMP on the launch pad,have them stomp with one foot,keep it under 100 ft. and you will be happy.

title: Safe and Sane Fun
body: The Stomp Rocket Jr. was used by 3 siblings (ages 2,4 and 7) and father constantly.  Rockets are soft and safe, but boy do they fly into the air, but sometimes end up on the roof!!!

title: good gift
body: a great choice if you love stomp rockets

title: good quality,
body: good quality,

title: Stomp rocket is fun but fragile
body: Was really fun while it lasted, but the harder you push for the rocket to launch, the faster the rocket's fins break off. We taped them back on but a better fin connection would greatly improve star rating

title: Great toy!
body: We bought it as a gift for our friend's boys. She keeps telling us how much they enjoy playing it. They even bought extra rockets! Great buy!

title: Great for a 11 year old boy.
body: My grandson called and told me he loved this.  He just turned 11 and it was perfect for his age.

title: This is one of the best gifts ever
body: This is one of the best gifts ever...for boys and girls, and even little kids (if they can jump). Great to take to the park...everyone wants to play!

title: Great toy, difficult stand to keep assembled
body: My son really likes this toy, and he's two, and I know he'll play with it a lot over the years, so good investment.The stand is a joke to keep assembled.  It's nice that it comes apart so it can fit back in the box, but I have had to duct tape it together so I'm not putting it back together every 3 minutes.

title: Poor Base
body: My niece and nephew loved this gift. Only downfall I disliked was the base did not stay together very well.

title: MUST HAVE for any age.
body: My daughter is 3 and loves, loves this toy.  I bought it to help encourage activity and it works.  She chases down the rocket she just launched and does it over and over again.  Bought extra rockets just in case.  Fun for everyone.  Great gift!  Get one for someone, you will be gald you did.

title: Buy it
body: Buy this toy.  It is simplicity at it's best, and every kid you know will want to play with it.  Best money spent in a long time!

title: 3, 2,1 Blast off!
body: Start the countdown. This was lots of fun for a three and five year old. Not sure how long it will last. The part kids step on to launch takes quite a  bit  of abuse. However, for the price  it is a fun toy.

title: Lighted rockets are too heavy - don't fly as high!
body: Rockets are too heavy!!! Our regular version of this stomp rocket was great. Rockets flew high, was easy to use. But these lighted rockets are too heavy. They bend the launcher, so someone has to hold it up while another person stomps, otherwise it falls over.  Also, these rockets don't shoot even half as far as the regular ones. Don't fall for the LED lights! Buy the regular stomp rocket!

title: Nephews loved it!!
body: I bought this for my nephews to play with at Thanksgiving to get them outside.  Their ages are 3 and 4, and they loved playing with it!!  It kept them busy for quite a long time, and even the adults had to give it a try.  Highly recommended as it can be used by many kids as they can easily take turns shooting off the rockets.

title: This thing ROCKS!!!!
body: my boys and all the kids in the playground just love it, even my 11 year old daughter plays with this!!!

title: It's a blast
body: I use this product for my line of work with children. I have yet to find a child who hasn't liked stomping on this stomp rocket. I've tried using other stomp rockets made from other companies, but their tubing was made of faulty material and either broke easily or did not provide the right kind of spacing needed to allow forceful air to flow through it. Once the tubing is broken, the stomp rocket is essentially useless.For it's price, you get a fun product that has wonderful replay value. As long as the child can depress the stomp pump hard and fast enough, the rocket will blast off.

title: Simple and endless fun for my boy (and cousins)!
body: I must admit that I had my reservations about this product, but i can now say that is completely amazing. My boy is just 2 years old, but he and his cousins enjoy so much the stomp rocket while they're playing it. It's a little cheap in its materials but well, it's not a expensive toy and creativity is the majority of the price in this case. Totally recommended.

title: Kids loved them. Don't buy the spare rockets or you ...
body: Kids loved them. Don't buy the spare rockets or you will never get off the roof! Kids love to shoot things on the roof. Guess to them it's like sending a rocket to the moon.

title: Great for the price
body: Two year old loved it!  perfectly simple.  Base could have been a bit sturdier, it kept falling apart.  Little duct tape took care of that.  For the price and amount of fun this is a great toy.

title: Fun product
body: My two grandsons are wearing it out. Good, cheap, safe fun and a toy they can play with without adult supervision.

title: Waste of money
body: Stand is so weak it bends over when the tube for rocket is connected. Its junk don't buy it.

title: Five Stars
body: Always a good choice for the young set.

title: Fun
body: The kids loved it but needed someone to hold the 'launcher' in place or it would lean to one side.

title: Lots of fun, but the rockets aren't too durable.
body: My 4 year old goddaughter and her friends loved this! They played with it for most of the duration of her birthday party. Unfortunately, the rocket fins did not hold up well against eager little hands fighting for a turn. The kids tore a lot of them off. I think they can be reattached, preferably with stronger glue. The rocket bodies themselves were made of good foam. I don't think the kids could tear them. The base was easy to put together, but came apart pretty quickly if the kids accidentally kicked it too much. However, the base parts were not damaged by this, so I just reassembled it.

title: Perhaps not the best choice of toy
body: The components of this rocket are nicely made, but it was not very easy to assemble.  Although a child's toy, adult assistance was required.The rocket fires quite a distance, but I have my doubts that it will be a much used/played with toy.

title: Five Stars
body: My students love these rockets and they are easy to put together

title: Ordered as B'day gift for 9 yr old boy....He loves it!!!
body: Ordered this for my nephew, and he loves it...He used it both indoors and outdoors, and was especially experimenting indoors for "Adjusting power settings) etc...Bottom-line, he loves it, and is well worth the cost!

title: Five Stars
body: GREAT GIFT

title: thanks for the quick delivery.
body: looks great so far, I'll let you know more after Yule. This is a present for my son. Will update after use.

title: Lots of fun in a small package!
body: I bought this for my nephew for his 5th birthday.  This was 3 weeks ago and I don't think he has stopped playing with it since.  All the neighborhood kids love it!  And it is even fun for adults.  It is amazing how high the rockets fly.  I would recommend this for kids of any age!!!  It is easy to set up and worth the price.  Suggestion:  Buy an extra set of the rockets.

title: Five Stars
body: a super toy

title: Wow
body: This rocket has been jumped on uncountable times. I bought it for a weekend party. Its lasted all winter, now into the summer with several kids and adults jumping on this thing as hard as they can. Great toy!!

title: Haven't met a kid who doesn't like it. However had to tape pieces together with ...
body: Haven't met a kid who doesn't like it. However had to tape pieces together with masking tape to stay together. Once we did this was perfect.

title: Goes high and fast without being a danger
body: Weeee!  These are fun.  And if you have a jerk of a kid who likes to be a brat and hit other kids with things, at least if he gets a hold of one of these things you won't have crying injured kids with parents who want to sue.These things go surprisingly high.  Keeps kids attention for a least an hour at a time.

title: Five Stars
body: Fun to play with

title: Hit of the Birthday Party
body: Only problem was the kids fought over who got to have a turn next.  Kids loved it!  No worries about injuries.  Awesome to keep on hand as a last minute gift for boy or girl!!

title: Great fun, great price, no damage.
body: One of the best purchases I have made.... seems strange because it's a cheap toy, but it works well and the kids love it. The flights have come off the styrofoam rockets, but they still go. It's nice have something that shoots rockets without destroying the family room!

title: ... to my 8 year old nephew and he was delighted with it
body: Gave this to my 8 year old nephew and he was delighted with it.

title: Five Stars
body: My nieces had so much fun playing with this, also the grown ups enjoyed it as well.

title: Best Gift @ 5 Year Old's Party
body: Finally - I gave the best gift at a party. What do you get for kids anymore? And not spending too much $ for a gift and the kid just says 'next'? The Stomp Rocket is it. I typed in 'boy's toys' into the Amazon search bar, and found this toy was in my price range. With about 20 gifts given at this 5 yr. old's outdoor BDay party, the Stomp Rocket was clearly the biggest hit (can be played w/ inside too). Although the party was a 'carnival' theme with booths, games, and concessions, most of the kids wanted to try this toy - the rockets really sore. One Mom came up to me, when she found out I gave it, and wants me to order one for her (she's not online). Kids from 2 to 7 were playing w/ it - I'd recommend this toy for this age group - after 7?  This gift was inexpensive enough that I also bought  the Stomp Rocket Refills.

title: great fun toy for any kid
body: this was a fun toy that was played with right out of the box for hours.  Lots of ways you can vary the angle of the shooter and play different games.  They sell glow in the dark rockets, but we painted some glow in the dark paint on our rockets and they were fun.

title: great toy
body: the kids love to stomp and see who gets the most distance-  has to be used in open area cause it gets caught in trees  a great toy

title: Perfect 10 year old gift!
body: Bought as a birthday gift for my son's friend.  He really liked it so I think it makes for a perfect gift.

title: Five Stars
body: Awesome fun!

title: Cheap Christmas gift. Don't expect it to last very long.
body: Cheap Christmas gift but it worked fine. It won't last long though. I could already see it's weaknesses but my nephew had fun with it.

title: Money well spent!
body: This toy has been a staple of outside play for my 3 year old for weeks now. Highly recommended for young boys!!!

title: AWESOME FOR EVERY AGE 2-100!!
body: Everybody LOVES this - the 2 year olds can jump on it and send the rocket into the air and adults really send it high. This always gathers a croud, is easy to travel with to do at a hotel, great for the neighborhood, company, anything!!! You will love this - but buy extra rockets as they do get into trees and on  roofs sometimes. You can even point outward for people to try to run and catch as a different game.

title: Tons of Fun
body: This is a classic birthday gift for any boy especially- but all would enjoy.  We've had a few adults join in too!  The most fun played with outside because these rockets can get up there.  More people ask me where I get these.

title: Four Stars
body: Not as great quality as I was expecting but fun toy none the less!

title: Five Stars
body: Fun!

title: It's a stomp rocket
body: It is what it is... kids love it

title: Wonderful!
body: I bought two stomp rockets for some boys (ages 3 and 4). They both loved it and it was easy or them to use. The shipping was fast! Would recommend for birthday gifts.

title: Kinda Lame
body: The rockets don't go very high - especially when a child does the stomping. As a 250 lb grown man I could only make them go about 35 ft or so.

title: Great fun
body: Great fun awesome purchase. My four year old and his friends love playing with this. It's put together fairly well, though the tripod mount slips apart pretty easily at times. Only problem we've had is keeping the dog from chasing and catching the rockets, already got two of them. Recommend buying the extra pack of rockets at the same time.

title: Awesome
body: This is an awesome product, except for one thing-- the base stinks.  It's a very dinky stand for kids who are stomping the heck out of this thing.  We ended up ditching the stand and my kids went all around outside carrying the thing and aiming it at anything and everything themselves.  It seemed more fun, anyway!  This is pretty much our staple birthday gift for 3-5 year old boys.

title: fun outside
body: Great fun for younger kids who are active.

title: Kids love it.  Lights last a long time
body: This was a perfect gift for my son who just turned 3.  My 18 month old also likes to play with it, but is a little small to get to rockets to go very far.  I have been surprised with the durability of the rockets and the LED lights work very well.  I am pretty sure we have left the rocket LED's on overnight a few times and the batteries still have not run down.  Overall I was very pleased with this purchase.

title: Five Stars
body: This is my go-to gift for birthday party's!

title: our 2 year old loves this
body: our 2 year old isn't quit strong enough to do it on his own but with a little help he loves this toy. he loves to watch the rockets and go get them and we help him set them off. really fun toy for the family.

title: a wonderful toy at a great price
body: a wonderful toy at a great price.. my 4,5 and 7 year old love this and play it for hours...

title: STOP wasting time and BUY IT ALREADY
body: The kids love it.  Every kid that saw it had a blast.  On the first they I got it for my little guys, I thought that they were going to break it.  It has taken a beating and they continue to work.  Sometimes they step on the plastic rockets and break the plastic.  A little time and up it goes again.  They all love it.

title: Awesome fun :)
body: Buy extra rockets! Haha. The included ones were stomped off into oblivion (roofs, trees, bushes, etc) on the very first day. Works great though! A lot of fun.

title: great, fun toy
body: Bought for my 6 yo grandson. He loves it and it is quite fun! The age stated 8 I believe, but this is perfect for the 6yo. I think the smaller one would have been too small.

title: Five Stars
body: For all ages... my kids always play with this

title: Great intertainment
body: The kids loved it, cheap intertainment, but the base is wobbly and needs some work. Had to tape down the bottom to keep it together.

title: 6 yr old nephew's favorite Xmas gift!
body: You know a gift is great when you give it to a child and they ignore all of their other gifts and play with only the one. That's what happened when I gave the Ultra Stomp Rocket to my 6 year old nephew. He and his friends played with it non-stop all day the first day, and they are still playing with it a week later. You'd think a bunch of 6 year old boys would have managed to break a plastic toy that they jump on, but so far it has managed to stand up to their rough use.The toy is very safe, too. The soft ends on the rockets mean that no one gets hurt should one accidentally fly into the crowd of kids. Apparently this toy is popular, too. The neighborhood kids in my own cul-de-sac own one as well. They're out in the court playing with the Ultra Stomp Rocket for hours at a time, nearly every day before school starts back up again.

title: One Star
body: 5year-old great grand son played with it for only a couple of times

title: You will be the most awesome person on the playground
body: We take this to the local playground and every one comes running. Size makes a definite difference in how much force you can apply to get the rockets to fly higher. It's fun trying to watch the little kids get all excited as they try to match how high I can get mine.We've taken the whole set out several times and all the pieces have held up really well. One kid actually tried to eat one of the rockets so it has a nice set of teeth marks and still works!

title: perfect for kids and adults!!!!
body: Love this!!!! durable and fun!  highly recommend this item for lots of laughter and giggles. Kids and adults love this!

title: buyer
body: bought it to have at my house for the grandkids. They love to play with it. It was a big hit.

title: So far so good with this one and the rockets go pretty high
body: This is the second stomp rocked we've owned.  The first one was the standard and my kids used and abused it for a year before it finaly broke apart.  So far so good with this one and the rockets go pretty high.

title: Five Stars
body: AAA

title: Great fun
body: We have really enjoyed this rocket.  It's great that it comes with four rockets.  The rockets seem like they could be broken easy, but so far they have held up great to my 4 boys playing with it.  It is definately a fun toy.  It's easy for my 2 year old to launch the rocket and still fun for my 10 year old.

title: love it
body: We played with this ALL afternoon in the cold Christmas Day.  Everyone was chasing my four year old grandson's rockets.  GREAT FUN and exercise for each of us.

title: Cheesy
body: The rockets do fly waaaaaay up there, but only if u can get the dang base to stay together

title: Reasonably priced and terrific gift
body: Terrific for 3-7 year old kids. Bought it many times as gifts and the kids love it. Beware though the wings do fall off, so glue it back with super glue. Hours of enjoyment.

title: good product.
body: I gave this to my 9-year-old nephew for his birthday -- he loves it! Prompt shipping, good product.

title: Fun inside or outside
body: All four of my children ranging in age from three years to 10 years and my husband love this product.  We used it outside with the stand and shot it high enough up in the sky that we lost sight of it until it came racing down.  Inside, we use it off the stand and aim it at a target or just across the room.  My youngest still has to stomp on it, but my older children can squeeze the launch pad under their arm to get it to go off.  Because it is the Jr. set and made entirely of foam, it doesn't hurt when it is launched directly at you.  I found this out, several times.  : )    The one downside of this toy is the stand.  We had to reassemble or readjust it after each launch.  It's quite flimsy.  However, if you're short enough, the stand isn't necessary when you stomp on the pad.  Just lay the pad down, hold the hose in your hand and stomp.      I'm not sure why this says it is a glow set, the rockets are white, but they don't glow.  Perhaps adding some glow stickers or paint would be fun.      If you shoot this outside, you will need a wide open space, the rockets are easily caught in trees.  Also, make sure there aren't any dogs around.  lol.  It only takes a second for them to destroy the rocket.    Overall, I am very pleased with this product and bought several more to use as birthday presents.

title: A Big Hit with our Grandsons
body: Impressive and fun gift that kids can open and enjoy right away.  (Which is fun for the grandparents.. to get to see them enjoying their toy so much immediately.)

title: Hours of Fun
body: I bought this for my 2 year old grandson and he loves it.  He has learned how to adjust the launcher to control the trajectory of the rocket in order to have in land in s specific area

title: Great for kids
body: My 5 year old loves his stomp rocket! He loves it so much we got a few more to give as gifts!

title: Four Stars
body: good price for a fun kid's item

title: So much fun!
body: I have bought a bunch of these as presents over the years- for friend's kids, and nephews/ nieces. This stomp rocket is so much fun. (I even like playing with it too.) Some kids don't quite get into it at first. But take them outside, show them how to use it, and challenge them to see how far they can get it to go. They have a blast!  Indoors- probably not recommended, but doesn't hurt much either. (Boys will try it indoors too!)

title: Awesome for little boys
body: I got this for my son's 5th birthday party and it was a complete hit.  Seeing the reaction of the other parents and kids I imagine a number of them will be buying these very soon.  It's such a simple concept yet completely entertaining and can also be used to teach basic principles of physics.  The age on the box is 8+ and I think older kids might be a bit bored with it.  I'm not sure why it is rated for such an old age because there are no small parts (except a screw assembly) and the rockets are very soft even when they land on heads - yes, my kids tested this.The little kids need very little strength to get it to work.  My 21-month-old was able to get it to go about a foot off the ground and was absolutely thrilled to be able to play with the bigger kids.  The heavier the kid, the higher the rocket goes which is an excellent way to start a conversation about science and get kids curious.  And, seeing the rocket launch and figuring out where it's going to go is an endless source of entertainment.All in all, the best money I have spent on a toy in a long time.

title: The HIT of the Party
body: Out of all the gifts I purchased, we the adults and the kids had a blast with this Stomp Rocket.  Highly recommended gift!  No batteries needed, just stomp it.  So cool!

title: Old time fun!
body: I have given this to my 4 & 5 year old nephews for their birthdays.  It was hit with both families.  Assembly was simple and quick.  The kids and grown ups enjoyed it.  I'm going to get one for 20 year old boys to play with!

title: Well worth the money - hours of fun!!
body: We bought a set of these at Costco for our oldest son four years ago. I REALLY wish I'd bought two sets because that set came with TEN rockets for the same price as this one that only comes with 4. The base on this toy IS flimsy...ours broke after only a few uses but my husband went to Home Depot and got 4 curved PVC pieces, connected them to an X piece and drilled a hole in the middle then stuck the black launch tube through and VOILA - a super sturdy base that has lasted us 4 years and is still going strong through MANY uses by all 3 of our kids. The best time was when we had it at the park and a bunch of random kids just lined up to each have a turn. We had a dozen kids in line and finally OUR kids complained they weren't getting enough turns. Unfortunately our last rocket just cracked and broke yesterday to my 3 year old's dismay. I'm disappointed this one only comes with 4 rockets but it's better to get this rather than just 4 replacement rockets. We're getting a set of the 'high performance' stomp rockets too for the two older kids (8 and 6). Get this toy - you won't be disappointed!!

title: Five Stars
body: Kids love this product!

title: Five Stars
body: Excellent

title: They loved it so much they didn't want to stop playing ...
body: A big hit! I bought this for my nephew who just turned 8. He and his friends at the birthday party took it right outside to play with. They loved it so much they didn't want to stop playing to eat the birthday cake. A perfect gift for an 8 year old.

title: Awesome toy!
body: Bought this for my son for Christmas and he LOVED it!  Very simple toy, but lots of fun to be had.

title: Totally Awesome!!
body: I bought this toy for my son's 4th Birthday and he LOVES it! I love it! Indoors/Outdoors..anywhere, it is light, durable, easy to assemble and super fun to play with.      He has learned much about angles, the wind and it's impact on the rocket and the dynamics of pressure applied from air. I highly recommend this toy to anyone with an active 3-4 year old!

title: Two Stars
body: These are really cheaply made.  The "launch pad" is so weak that it barely stands up.

title: Five Stars
body: loads of fun

title: Tons of Fun
body: We graduated to the Ultimate Stomp Rocket after kids out grew the Stomp Rocket Junior.  A really fun toy, the kids burn a ton of energy blasting them off then retrieving them.  Even the 'big kids' like these.

title: Don't stomp too hard!
body: I was really excited to order Stomp Rocket Jr. for my grandson for Christmas.  He was delighted with it, and had a 'stomping good time' for about 20 minutes, then one of the three legs of the yellow plastic base broke.  He was disappointed....the rocket wouldn't stand up by itself... no more stomping. So, grandpa to the rescue.  He built a four legged wooden stand to support the rocket, and off the rocket flew again.  The concept is good, the stand didn't hold up.

title: Rocket
body: This rocket was a gift for my son.  He liked it very much.  The harder you stomp on the launch pad the higher it goes up In the air.  This item arrived quickly.

title: Ultra Stomp Rocket
body: Our rambunctious grandson and his siblings loved this.  Just the thing to give a kid with a lot of energy who can have a fun getting rid of some of it!!!  It was a great purchase.

title: ... my grandsons last year for Christmas and they both loved it!
body: Bought for my grandsons last year for Christmas and they both loved it!!  Ages 4 and 7

title: The stand doesn't stay together easily, but a little duct tape solves that problem
body: The stand doesn't stay together easily, but a little duct tape solves that problem. My 7 year old son enjoys it.

title: hours of stompin' fun
body: really fun for the kids and easily amused adults (like myself).the plastic stands are a little flimsy and the duct tape came out on the first day of play.overall, a great time! buy two so the kids don't fight over it.

title: Five Stars
body: Got this for my best friend's boys and they loved it!!

title: Fun toy for indoors as an artillery and outdoors for a rocket launch.
body: Great toy. The base is weak. It needs secured together rather than the snapping type system designed in. I drilled a hole through all pieces of the base when assembled. Through that hole I fastened the base legs with a nut and bolt.

title: Nephews love it!
body: I bought this for my 9 and 3 year old nephews and even Dad loves it!  A fun toy that can be used inside as well since the rockets are foam and won't cause much damage.

title: Mindbogglingly poor design for the rocket stand as it is constantly ...
body: Mindbogglingly poor design for the rocket stand as it is constantly falling apart upon the slightest bit of contact. I had to saw into the stand further in order for it to stay together. Still didn't. I have now taped it together.Looked like part of the hose had experienced some kind of pressure almost to the point of puncture before arrival. The drilled hole for part of the stand had the excess plastic still coiled around the edges. Very shoddy.The rocket does fly high when it works, though.

title: Lots of fun for all ages!
body: This is really a neat toy that many children can enjoy at different ages.  And, adults have fun watching the children have so much fun & once in awhile jump in to see if they can stomp a rocket too - LOL.     We've used it about 5 times over the last 2 weeks & it has held up well.  There was a 13 year old, a 10 year old & a 2 year old.  The older one's stomped on the rocket while the youngest loved watching the rockets launch into the sky.  They then would run & find the rockets & bring them back to the older children to do it again.  It was fun for all of them & nice that it was something they could do together.    The age range is for older kids, but little one's can join in too w/ help & supervision.  However, I do want to point out that supervision for the younger one's is very important.  The foam of the rockets is basically styrofoam & if bitten off could be very unsafe.  Don't let little one's around this by themselves.  Safety is top priority.    Overall rating is lots of fun for children (and adults - smile) of all ages, but if smaller children are around adult supervision is needed so they don't get the rocket in their mouths.    This comes w/ 4 rockets, but if you have a lot of trees I suggest ordering some extras.  What goes up doesn't always come down if you have a lot of trees for them to get stuck in.    OH!  The fact that they glow is super cool!  They do indeed glow & if you have them inside at night they are lit up.  Just wanted to point out they do glow & very well.

title: Quality Buy
body: Way better quality than anticipated! Great for all ages... my husband probably had the most fun teaching the kids how to shoot it towards each other.

title: Entertaining for all ages
body: This is a fun toy/activity for kids and adults!  My preschooler received this for Christmas from my mother, a former teacher who only buys educational gifts for the grandkids.  The packaging doesn't seem very exciting - even the instruction sheet included makes the toy seem kind of cheap.  Set up takes about 3 minutes - very easy.  We walked this over to the park since we weren't sure if the rockets would land on the roofs or get caught in the trees around our house.  Once we had it going, everyone kept trying to get another turn.  Even my 3 year old was able to send the rocket flying and he hardly weights anything!  We now keep it in the bottom of our stroller for when we go for walks.  We like to take it out and play with it for a few minutes when we come to a park or field.  So far the rockets have held up well.  We have only used rocket so far and I think it will last for a few more months.

title: Better than the Stomp Rocket
body: After reading the reviews, I bought both the Stomp and Ultra Rockets to compare them.In each case, as others have stated, they go about half the advertised heights. About 50 feet and 100 ft actual height, respectively.I also found the launch pad to be flimsy, but it works. I ended up laying logs on each leg of the launch pad to keep it steady.Besides the rocket shapes and materials, the only difference in the two sets is that the launch tube for the Ultra Stomp is a couple of inches longer than the Stomp tube. That's why the Ultra goes higher. The Ultra Stomp launch tube is black so you can tell it from the Stomp launch tube which is blue. You really need the weight of an adult to get it to go the maximum height. My 2 1/2 year old, 38 pound grandson could not get a rocket from either set to launch with one foot. It was still fun using these sets and will suffice until  the kids are a little older and can use the Estes model rockets with real rocket engines that go 1000 feet.

title: One of the rockets broke on the first launch
body: Great toy. Sad that one of the rockets broke on the first launch - the foam on the top just bursted. To send it back for replacement would actually be more expensive than to buy another one. Bummer.

title: Very fun for kids
body: Purchased for my 3 year old grandson and he loved it. Took it to a park and had kids there lining up to take their turn. Very fun product.

title: Fun, but flimsy.
body: No doubt, the kids love it. However, I bought this as a gift for my nephew and when we brought it out, I was very disappointed in the quality for the price. It was flimsy and light. I gave it three stars because, the kids didn't care and still had fun.

title: Kids love it
body: The grown ups don't love it as much as the kids, to be sure.  But the kids are fascinated by it.  Most popular Christmas gift even though it cost far less than the other gifts.

title: Kids loved it.
body: Seven year old grandson and four year old granddaughter both loved it. Rocket worked well, launch base was a bit flimsy, but for the price everything was satisfactory.

title: Five Stars
body: the stomp rocket was a great hit with my grandsons, they can play in and outdoors with it

title: Love using Stomp Rockets in the classroom
body: Love using Stomp Rockets in the classroom. Students can engineer their own rockets using paper (cardstock works great), small paper cup, and tape. Educational and fun- It's a win-win if you ask me.

title: Simple, but fun for outside
body: Not much too this, so make sure you don't pay much for it...but its fun for a little outside game.

title: Five Stars
body: My three year old loves it.

title: Great  Toy
body: This is a great toy. My grandchildren  (ages 3 and 6) both enjoy making the rockets fly indoors and outdoors. Since the rockets are made of nerf-like material, they don't hurt anything.  Would  give it 5 stars, but the stand that comes with the stomp rocket is a pain.  It falls apart way too easily.

title: Fun!!
body: My girls love this, they use it at the park when we go and have a blast with it. Simple but fun. It shoots up about 60+ feet in the air if you stomp correctly. Fun!!

title: Great toy
body: What can I say?  This stomp rocket is fun for everyone.  It's pretty simple, easy for all ages to use, and flies really high into the air.  Our puppy chewed up our base and I'm ordering another.

title: They will love it.
body: Pretty sturdy.  The kids like it a lot.  It's pretty fun.

title: Three Stars
body: toy

title: Three Stars
body: Awesome fun! Horrible base construction. We gave up on the base and just hold the tube our selves

title: surprise hit
body: This was simply a Christmas stocking stuffer but ended up being the hit present.  It's still working and popular as I write this review the following April!

title: Great fun
body: My 3 year old son absolutely loves this toy.  He will play with it in the backyard for ages by himself.  When we have playdates with other kiddos, they are all equally enthralled.  The rockets are pretty flimsy, we've already lost one when a kid stepped on the thing, so I guess I'd recommend to buy some extras and keep a hidden reserve in case the kids lose all the rockets in the neighbor's yard.

title: fun
body: This is a fun toy my 6 year old granddaughter love itshe stomped and it flew.I dont know if it was 200 feet asadvertised but it was pretty high

title: good toy
body: these work really well I would guess we could easily get 100 feet out of it easy enough that once assembled 4-5 year olds can use it w no issues

title: Kids love this toy
body: Your children will love this toy. You will not. Make sure you don't have any priceless china in the same room as children operating this toy.

title: awesome gift!
body: 7 year old loves it...awesome gift!

title: Hours of entertainment
body: My 4 year old son received this as a gift for his 4th birthday. He plays with it for hours at a time. This year I have purchased 4 of them for gifts for his friends birthdays. The refills are also available through Amazon which makes it easy to replace the ones we shoot over the fence or the house! Great toy!

title: Great outdoor fun!
body: I bought this rocket stomper for my 5 year old nephew and he loves it!!  This was his surprise toy for a camping vacation.  He was thrilled with how high he could launch this rocket by simply stomping on the air peddle.  He had all the adults running around trying to catch the rockets that were flying too far away.  Definitely need a big open area with no trees, otherwise the rockets will get stuck in the branches (yes, the rockets go that high).The only downside is that it's all made of plastic so the rocket launcher is a little flimsy.  We solved that by having someone hold the launcher in place while my nephew stomped on the pedal.  The person holding down the launcher is also able to aim the rockets in any direction.  So that was another fun game aiming the rockets to hit targets.This turned out to be a great toy for my nephew and all the campers (adults and kids)!

title: Better than the normal stomp rockets
body: The launcher can be (somewhat) folded up for storage, and these rockets seem to fly better than the garden variety stomp rockets.  We haven't tried the "glow" part yet, so I'm not sure how that works.

title: Somewhat expensive for what it really is but my kid ...
body: Somewhat expensive for what it really is but my kid loves it. Buy some extra rockets, first time we used it 2 got stuck on a tree. :)

title: fun while it lasts :)
body: My nephews love these little rockets - probably will need to buy more refills, though.  They shoot very high, and the boys really get into stomping the launcher.

title: Huge hit
body: This is always a great hit with little boys for birthday presents. My kids have been through a couple. If they held up better I'd give it five stars but I just figure its worth replacing after a while.

title: My kids love this toy, but not sure how long it will last.
body: My kids are obsessed with their new stomp rocket. They've played with it almost every day since we gave it to them. The biggest downfall is that the fins fall off the rockets easily so I'm not sure how long it will last. We also had to tape the stand together because it kept falling apart.

title: Four Stars
body: Worked great.

title: Fun but not totally durable
body: My two boys, ages 7 & 4, absolutely love playing with this toy!!  The only thing I wasn't crazy about and would recommend if you do purchase this is to buy extra rockets because after some use the rockets can crack and then they don't blast off because of splits in the plastic.  Also the tripod that the rocket launcher is made of doesn't want to stay together so I found myself constantly putting it back together for my boys.  Maybe if it we hot-glued it that problem would be fixed.

title: Great Toy
body: I bought this toy for my 3 year old son as a Christmas gift and it was a hit, not only with my son but with the whole family. Everyone wanted to give it a try and see who could launch the highest rocket. Would definitely purchase again.

title: excellent way to get the wiggles out before bed
body: a night version of this....excellent way to get the wiggles out before bed!!

title: Five Stars
body: Good item

title: good toy for kids
body: Bought this for my 3 year old nephew.  He really enjoyed it, once he figured out he had to really jump on the launcher to get the rockets to go.  As adults, we were able to shoot the rockets really high (couple landed on the roof).  Since they are made of styrofoam, we could even launch the rockets in the house without any damage.

title: Disappointed after other reviews
body: A short-lived toy the kids used to invent another way to use it.

title: Five Stars
body: always a winner at my daycare
